result.execSummary:
The defendant Epifanio Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants 2 days jail credit towards the fine ($100.00). Balance to be paid in 180 days or penalty of 4 days jail, consecutive for non-payment.
Costs to be paid in 180 days or penalty of 4 days jail, consecutive for non-payment.

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

**Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

records.addlTxt: letter from Defendant to police officers
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Epifanio Hernandez in court with Attorney Eryn M Menden.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Menden makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  FINE:  $316.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (Defendant give 2 days jail credit at rate of $50.00 each day ($100.00) and remainder to be paid in 180 days, alternate 8 days jail if not paid)

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department**

***Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.***
